meta.description: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club at John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK), Terminal 4, Concourse B. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

location.description: Queens, New York City, NYC, New York, United States

lounge.description: The Delta Sky Club is an award-winning retreat that allows relaxation, productivity, or both.

reviews.content: Busy, but had everything one needs.
Ridiculously crowded! Line at the entrance, line to the men’s room, line at the bar, line for food,...  has to be my least favorite of all the Sky Clubs I’ve visited. I’ll skip JFK next trip!
I used to like this lounge a lot. Mostly because I would take early flights & it wasn’t crowded. Unfortunately, it’s more crowded now in general & they changed the bar area from sitting to standing.
Big but definitely crowded. Like an actual line to get in! The food was OK. I wouldn’t write home about it but decent for snack or light meal. Definite shoutout to the smiling staff.
Often crowded, boring/mediocre food and indifferent service for the masses of people who use it. It is perpetually disorganized and not very relaxing or quiet. Delta should do a lot better for JFK.
Nothing to write home about, but a good place to grab coffee, some snacks, and check out the sky deck.
Flew out of T4 often & always disappointed with the poor quality of T4 lounges including this Delta. Same food over all seasons and the entire nation - what a boring system that makes no effort...
Been to many Delta Sky Clubs, this is at the bottom of the list. Over packed with all that brings, won’t fly through JFK again if I can help it.

This place is all about the outdoor terrace. Sat there during a layover, in the sun, watching all the amazing international traffic on the apron. Inside? It's a bit better than your average DL lounge.
It’s OK. Breakfast options are limited. No self serve soda machine. No alcohol before 8 am.
This lounge is always packed but it’s still better than most Sky Club locations. The service also suffers because of how crowded they are...
Definitely better food than the lounge in terminal 2. The sky lounge is a nice concept but for NY summer it’s too toasty.
Generally above average Sky Club. The SkyDeck is nice and the lounge and showers are decent. Can’t get very packed at times though.
Insanely busy lounge. Very difficult to find seats. The lounge is loud with no quiet area to truly rest. Slow food and bar service. If you have access to another lounge, use it.
Good lounge. I could access with my Amex Platinum. Decent buffet spread.
No hot breakfast but otherwise a really nice lounge.

This an excellent lounge. Lots of different spaces to stretch out in as well as various areas. Cushy chairs, workstations, outside space to watch planes take off and land. Bar and food were above par.
Very spacious, decent food, great views!
Warmly greeted and quickly ushered into a spacious lounge with lots of seating. There is a well tendered bar and small buffet for refreshments. Easy to use wifi and great terminal views.
Hello SkyDeck patio during summer time! Just excellent. Staff are the sweetest. The Skyroom (Quiet Room) currently under construction! Food always great.
Very clean and beautiful lounge. Comfortable seats, good food and great showers!
Spacious, convenient, and clean lounge. Premium drinks for purchase, but plenty of free drinks and food. Tons of outlets and seating. Nothing fancy, but certainly helpful.
A great lounge at Terminal 4. The sky deck is great when it's nice weather. Servers clearing dirty dishes will ask you if you would like another drink. Good food selection for US lounge.
Bad food, bad internet, crowded, but at least plenty of seats. Staff not so friendly as should be.
One of the nicest lounges i've been to in the US. Good food selection, plenty of seating, amazing staff. My flight is in another terminal, and I'm still in this lounge waiting for my flight.
I'm seriously tired of being turned away from Delta Sky Clubs. This is the 2nd time in a row that I'm not important enough to have access or even BUY access to the lounge.
Awesome lounge - hot foods, big bar, multiple drink stations, showers, and a patio. Only thing that kind of sucked was it was pretty packed (Thursday at 5pm).
Overall I thought this lounge was great.  Reception was polite and helpful, space was varied & plenty of seating, but it was a Sunday. Food was usual Delta + some extra variety. Bright and relaxing.
A busy, well-run lounge with updated amenities and attentive service. Food was pretty good, with a good selection. A large space with varied seating options and lots of places to charge.
Mad warm. Food choices are lacking for sure. If I have a choice. I won't come here again.
Not too crowded on a Monday night.. food is pretty good and always well stocked! Plenty of seats available. And not difficult to find a quiet space.
Very large with plenty of seating decent food/drink selection with attentive staff. Not Centurion Lounge good but it's not bad for a domestic lounge.
Pluses include WiFi and showers. Minuses: harsh lighting, crowded, a line at the bar, charging for alcohol and terrible food.

Probably among the best lounges in JFK. Spacious, good wifi, good food spread, nice terrace, tarmac view, good showers, etc. Two stars because charging for the bar at a flagship lounge is inexcusable.
Spacious, alot of seating. Here in the am. Bagels, yogurt, cereal, fruit. At 7pm starts hot food.  Looks like it will be scrambled eggs and what not.
We visited this lounge after taking a red eye from Utah and before flying to Dubai. The breakfast and showers were great for the 29$ each we paid with the Amex.
The best domestic lounge I've been to.
This is one of the larger and nicer SkyClubs that I have been to. I wish the SkyDeck had been open when I was visiting.
Much better than most US lounges. The outdoor area is amazing and great for watching planes. Free food selection was decent.
This is such a vast improvement on former sad Delta lounges. The best part of flying Delta used to be the Skyteam lounge at Heathrow. Almost as good. Kale chicken Caesar salad was excellent tonight.
Not as large as I was expecting, actually. Great selection of snack foods, including an excellent gnocchi! Bar, not self serve, and it was too busy to approach. I'd go back for the food.
Shower is the best part of this lounge.
Nice, very large lounge with lots of seating. Limited snacks. Great views of airport.
Breakfast is meh....cold continental style offerings....the only hot food is lumpy oatmeal. Wingtips is way better food-wise. Lounge is clean & spacious otherwise, with lots of outlets.
One of my favorite Sky Clubs. Large, clean, and has great food and coffee options including self serve Starbucks machines. Staff is friendly. Showers and sky deck are also a highlight.
Spacious lounge with cool decor. Typical Sky Club snack and drink offerings - not great. The deck is fantastic.
Great domestic lounge, with solid hit food and drink selections. Can get busy but not usually an issue with seating. Outside deck is awesome, even had a server coming around getting drink orders.
This is one of the nicest US lounges I've ever been in. Certainly top Delta domestic lounge. This lounge is HUGE. Probably 10 different sections. Food selection could be improved though.
Excellent US lounge; this lounge outshines the AA Flagship Lounge in its modern design, the friendly service, and the extensive paid menu. Lack of a large free buffet keeps it from being world class.
Best Delta lounge in the USA for sure!
Like all Delta lounges - cheap. Low quality food. Crappy showers. Disappointing considering the price they charge for airfare.
Came early in the morning so not many people. It's a nice perk!

Typical "Delta Lets Everyone In" Lounge. Overcrowded and understaffed - too many chairs available at bar encourage credit card access persons to annex the bar for free Finlandia. Disappointing overall.
Really big lounge and open late (Virgin kicked me out of the Clubhouse at 9pm). Really fast wifi and smooth check in process. Close to the Delta gates.
Great lounge, clearly the flagship for Delta. Don't forget to get a delicious breakfast on arrival to NYC.
By US Standards, this is a roomy, fantastic-looking lounge. However, only basic beverages and mediocre snacks are offered.
Very spacious and nice lounge with a great patio. Good selections of snacks and beers. Bud/Coors/Miller is free. Nicer beers are not, but seems to discounted ($3 for a Stella).
Very big, but disappointing that you have to pay for food and drinks, which are free in the KLM and Air France lounges. Very limited snack selection too. Not really worth it.
I wouldn't recommend paying for entry. When I was here, it was very crowded with a limited selection of free food and drinks.
This is probably the nicest Delta lounge in the U.S. They did a stellar job.
This is a modern, spacious, and well-equipped lounge! On a nice day, be sure to check ou the amazing Sky Terrace!
Check out the SkyDeck to watch for planes.
This place is alright: free snacks, and no self-service abilities.
The SkyDeck is a great place for spotting. The lounge itself is nice and roomy with lots of plugs to charge devices. "Premium" cocktails are the only negative.

location.terminalDirections: After security, Level 4, next to Gate 5.

location.terminalDirections: After you go through security, you can find it just beyond the TSA checkpoints to the left of the escalators that take passengers downstairs to the gate level. If you are arriving on the gate level from a connecting flight, please head towards the A concourse and take the stairs or elevator up to the 4th floor to find the lounge.
